Description: Body sherd of Aeolian black-figured(?) pottery amphora; exterior: animal motif consisting of large black bird (thigh and right leg with added white remaining) to right; possible tendril at right; below, two narrow black bands and larger black band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Modern inscription written in ink 'NAU 18' on break (accession number used in clay analysis). According to Dupont and Thomas (2006, p. 80, NAU18), the geophysical characteristics of the fabric indicate that the sherd originated in Aeolis.
Bibliographic references: Dupont & Thomas 2006 / Naukratis: Les Importations Grecques Orientales Archaïques (p. 78, 80, 82-83, fig. 1) (NAU 18)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.22)
